meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dirty or impure.
meanings.sent1: The uncleanness of the kitchen floor was evident from the sticky spills and crumbs scattered around.
meanings.sent2: She tried to clean the uncleanness from her clothes after playing in the mud.
meanings.sent3: The uncleanness of the dog's paws left muddy prints all over the freshly mopped floor.
meanings.sent4: The uncleanness of the river water was a stark reminder of the pollution in the city.
meanings.sent5: The uncleanness of the public restroom made her cringe in disgust.

meanings.definition: Something that is dirty or impure.
meanings.sent1: He couldn't stand the uncleanness of the old abandoned house filled with dust and cobwebs.
meanings.sent2: The uncleanness of the stagnant pond was evident from the foul smell emanating from it.
meanings.sent3: The uncleanness of the spilled ink on her homework made it illegible.
meanings.sent4: The uncleanness of the crime scene left a chilling feeling in the air.
meanings.sent5: The uncleanness of the moldy bread made her lose her appetite.
